wikipedia_page.main: Jonathan Staley (1868 – 1917) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Derby County.

response: Derby County formed a baseball team in 1900 which Steve Bloomer played for in that season. Their first game was played on 19 May 1900. It contained, with Bloomer and among others, players who were or had been, members of Derby County football team up to that date: Enos Bromage (footballer, born 1864), Hugh McQueen, Jonathan Staley, John Goodall, and Jimmy Methven. They played in a local league against Derby, Ilkeston, Belper, Chesterfield and Notts Forest."Notes On Outdoor Sports". Derby Daily Telegraph, Wednesday 09 May 1900, p.4. Via British Newspaper Archive. Retrieved 28 September 2021. However, both Derby baseball teams do not appear to have existed after 1900.
